caption: It was an amazing experience to be there at paradox museum. It is a must visit place for parents with their children. It is educative and entertaining at the same time. The only thing that I noticed was there were way less number of employees for clicking pictures and for suggesting what exactly the paradox is in some of the frames. Otherwise the experience was good. More number of people might have more fun.

Super nice museum. I was alone here and the employees helped me with the photos and explained me everything. Had a lot of fun and would come again. Alone it took me about one hour, I think when you gonna visit it with kids, it takes a bit more time. 5/5 Stars.

Fun experience for the whole family.  Great activity on a rainy day.   Suggest buying tickets in advance.  Family discount available mid-day.  Only suggestion is to have more staff available to help take photos to keep lines shorter.
Nothing spectacular as I 've been to similar museums before. The entrance fee for adults is 26 euros. I wouldn't go the the second time. Good place for taking intresting pictures tho

This museum is really cool, and I recommend visiting with a group to fully enjoy all the attractions, for this approximate hour long adventure.  The staff is incredibly accommodating; even though I was alone, they offered to take my pictures and participate with me in some of the attractions that require multiple participants. It made the experience even more enjoyable and memorable.
Nice place, little bit overrated, cool for child. 29€ Really expensive
A great place for kids to discover visual tricks and effects. A lot of spots to take amazing picture shots. Friendly staff available to provide advice

The experience was super great. We had fun at the center. I'd visit again. Also, all the attendants were nice especially Cassandra, she was all smiley and very friendly  and extremely willing to explain how to use the rooms and take our pictures.

Very cool experience that plays with your brain. You can get special mind bending photos to surprise your friends with. The place is very organized and the staff are very helpful and informative, they can teach you about the illusions and how to see some of them. Great experience 10/10 recommended.

It was a good and fun experience. You have to go definitely with some friends to make it more fun. I don't think you can have enough fun alone. We were 2 and sometimes for some of the rooms, there was no one so we asked other people to take our picture and they were nice enough to accept to take it but not the best one with the camera. And it's not easy to ask them to take more because they failed :)  Since you are waiting a lot in some of the rooms, it can kill the mood (we went there on Sunday). There isn't a structure to wait on the queue, so sometimes you realize that some people are just passing you while waiting. I need to admit, it was still a bit pricey.  Overall, if you have 1 hour to spend with some friends and you like taking funny photos, give it a shot.

This place could have been great. Lots of great exhibits to play with, take funny photos with your family etc.  Unfortunately the owners are clearly too greedy and let too many people in at the same time meaning there are crazy queues at each point. Most oeople just gave up and moved on.  A real shame but would avoid as it’s a complete waste of time and money. Maybe work out when it’s not full.

Expensive admission but it’s quite fun for kids. For the price tag I was hoping it would take longer to get through. It does help to have a party of at least three people to fully enjoy the experience as many of the sets are designed for two people or more to participate.

Do not miss this while in Paris. While it’s not beautiful statues or stunning oil painting, it is a proper mind bender that you will remember. Great time with kids as well as adults. Highly recommend. Note though that it’s not cheap. $$$$
Nice experience ❤️very interesting and staffs are friendly. Don’t hesitate to ask for their help with taking photos.

Not that into art so I can truly say this is the museum that I enjoyed the most in Paris. Its a ton of fun and the exhibits are in both French and English which is nice. I definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Paris that wants a fun activity outside of the traditional attractions.

Amazing family experience. Needs almost 1h. The place is new and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful (provides explanation as needed, helped us take the right angle for the photos and took photos of us in the less crowded experiences)

The best thing about visiting this museum is the staff, wow. The most polite and patient staff in the whole of Paris(haha). They helped us take lovely pictures, explained the concept of some of the structures, even suggesting some poses for us. Definitely recommend.
One of the best place to spend the limited time in Paris, gain best experience from here, price also reasonable
Very much fun for the kids! A little too pricey.
Can I just say" Amazing".We booked a slot and we didn't wait too much before enter. Staff is so kind and friendly and the whole experience , especially for kids,it's just wonderful.Highly recommended
Was a ton of fun for the entire family (3 kids 12 and under). Spent 2 hours playing with the puzzles, looking at the illusions and just having a great time. Would recommend to anyone with kids.
Thank you so much Yvens for guiding us! We had a lot of time and good memories to bring home
Not bad. Fun enough to pass the time. Helpful staff. Good for families with young-ish children (old enough to listen and not run off). Very tactile. Bring lots of hand sanitizer.

This museum was so much fun for us: hubby, me and our 24 year old. I think it's fun for any age. Don't assume it's just for kids. We laughed and learned and had a great time exploring.  The science of each exhibit makes the museum more interesting. Be ready to read signs explaining how to best interact and what scientific theory is at work. This place was created to make memories! Be ready to take lots of pics and vids. Don't be afraid to be creative and silly with pics. The staff, in their black and white "scan code" jumpsuits, is super helpful. We especially appreciated Raphaël's help in the kaleidoscope room and at the dinner table. He clearly enjoys his job helping people and explaining things.  He took photos for us and helped us get the most out of our visit.  Other staff were great too. When you buy your online tickets, I recommend paying close attention to when the time slots are busiest. Plan your visit to catch the slots that have lots of available tickets so it won't feel so crowded.  We bought our tickets for 1:30 with the next a couple of hours of slots sold out. Our visit was crowded and we did wait at most stops and skipped a couple because of lines.  I think for the day we went, a morning visit might have been less crowded. Bottom line? So worth the time and price of admission. Thanks Paradox for such a fun afternoon.
Great fun for the kids. Mostly mirrors based illusions but often interactive. Great place for photos which are highly encouraged. A little busy but the staff was managing the flow of visitors.

We had a great experience at this museum, I went with my wife and son, we all had a great time, definitely worth every cent, the museum is a good size and you'll get about an hour and a half of fun, every attraction is unique and interesting, the staff and also very kind.
It is a fun activity for families and friends. Well done, a bit cheesy at times but it is part of the fun. Price is really too expensive for the experience, not sure it is worth.

Excellent museum, especially for kids but not only. Very interactive and loads of fun. We discovered it by randomly seeing a poster in the tube so decided to go as we had time kill before our train. The staff was super helpful and friendly. This is full of optical illusions and fun photo opportunities. I would definitely recommend.
Excellent place for visiting with your family or friends 😀 great place to have fun and to understand the art of illusions.  Perfectly spent time 👌
Good experience and lots of fun, easy to spend a few hours in there. All the staff were very good and helpful in taking pictures and explaining things.

Super fun experience! Interactive museum with lots of visual illusions. Its so great to try and figure some of them out and take funny photos with other ones. The staff are so helpful and can help you in taking the best picture. I think kids will be amazed and for those without kids its perfect to get some cool photos for the gram ;)
It was a unique experience - but better suited for children under age 16. We enjoyed the mirrors and the piano. But some of the exhibits didn’t work well so we were a bit bored.
Cool when parents don't just let their kids run amok. Absolutely ruins the experience when parents won't keep their kids from getting in your pictures and screaming
This was a great place to visit and fun for the family. We have some fantastic photos and the staff are very friendly and helpful. There are many staff to help take great photos.
It was a really nice experiences. The workers assistance was wonderful. They were always available and showing us the best position to take for the pictures
Nice experiences, helpfull staff but a bit too crowded, even if tickets are based on time slots. Kids will love it, adults too. Don’t forget your phones and cameras.
Very good experience, make your brain thinking
So much fun we went with kids and adults and we all had a great time!!
